Download files from Google Drive folder

Source: R/download_google_drive.R
download_google_drive.Rd

This function retrieves a list of files from a specified Google Drive folder and downloads files that match the provided title patterns. If no title patterns are provided, all files in the folder will be downloaded. Files are downloaded to a temporary directory.

Usage

download_google_drive(
  folder_link,
  title = NULL,
  overwrite = FALSE,
  case_sensitive = FALSE,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

folder_link

Character string. The Google Drive folder URL or ID.

title

Character vector of patterns to match against file names. Uses regex pattern matching. If NULL (default), all files are downloaded.

overwrite

Logical. Whether to overwrite existing files. Default is FALSE.

case_sensitive

Logical. Whether pattern matching should be case sensitive. Default is FALSE.

verbose

Logical. Whether to print progress messages. Default is TRUE.

Value

A list containing:

  • temp_dir: The temporary directory path where files were downloaded

  • files: A data frame with information about downloaded files, including:

    • name: Original file name

    • local_path: Local path where file was saved

    • downloaded: Logical indicating if download was successful

    • error_message: Error message if download failed

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Download all files from a folder using URL
result <- download_google_drive("https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/ABC?usp=sharing")

# Download all files from a folder using ID
result <- download_google_drive("1ABC123def456GHI789jkl")

# Download files matching specific patterns
result <- download_google_drive(
  folder_link = "https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1ABC123def456GHI789jkl",
  title = c("report_", "\\.csv$", "data_2024")
)

# Access the temporary directory and files
print(result$temp_dir)
print(result$files)

# List downloaded files
list.files(result$temp_dir)
} # }
